label: 国衙
本: Capital and Countryside in Japan, 300-1180:  Japanese Historians Interpreted in English . Cornell University East Asia Program . 2006
説明文: the provincial headquarters and its administration. The provincial domain made up of public fields (kôden 公田) was called kokugaryô 国衙領, in opposition to privately held estates (shôen). Provincial law was called kokugahô 国衙法.
